name: Electro-Mechanical Systems

timeGuidelines.description: The standard instructional time for the day-time course offering is 90 hours.

description: Electro-mechanical Systems is an introductory course to the world of automation for manufacturing. The course includes theory and lab activities involving pneumatic, electrical, electro-pneumatic, robotics, and computer control applications. The course design is for the beginner who is new to the various control systems and will benefit all Mechanical Engineering Technologists in the workplace as many companies adopt automation for sustainable growth of evolving and competitive manufacturing industries. Cross-referenced to the National Technology Benchmarks (NTB).
timeGuidelines: The standard instructional time for the day-time course offering is 90 hours.
additionalRequirements: This course is subject to the Mechanical Engineering Technology (MET) Program Student Guide.

learningOutcomes.title: Apply Boolean principles to control systems
objectives: Discuss the differences between binary, octal, decimal and hexadecimal number systems
Convert numeric values from one number system to another
Describe the characteristics of various Boolean operators
Construct combinational Boolean expressions
Interpret binary coded decimal (BCD) values
Discuss analog to digital (A/D) and digital to analog (D/A) conversions
Discuss the fundamentals of series and parallel communication

learningOutcomes.title: Interpret electric circuit drawings using industry standard symbols
objectives: Discuss the concepts of voltage, current and resistance
Identify electric circuit drawing symbols
Apply Ohm's Law to electric circuits
Apply Kirchhoff's Voltage Law to electric circuits
Describe electric power sources
Apply the Power Law to electric circuits

learningOutcomes.title: Design motor control safety and relay logic circuits using examples
objectives: Construct circuits using switches, buttons, lights, and relays in series and parallel
Apply standard electrical automation devices in control circuits
Explain an emergency shutdown electrical safety device used in a circuit application
Practice troubleshooting skills in each electric circuit application
Discuss ladder diagram circuits
Discuss ladder diagram drawing procedures
Explain mechanical interlock
Describe control and load device symbols

learningOutcomes.title: Document pneumatic circuits using industry standard symbols
objectives: Discuss pneumatic power
Identify pneumatic circuit drawing symbols
Discuss pneumatic drawing procedures
Identify air source elements
Explain pneumatic valve, control device and actuator symbols
Explain the difference between direct and indirect control systems
Explain the difference between bi-stable and mono-stable directional control valves

learningOutcomes.title: Design a small pneumatic control system for a given application
objectives: Construct circuits using 3/2 way and 5/2 way directional control valves with pistons
Construct circuits using direct and indirect control systems
Construct circuits using bi-stable and mono-stable directional control valves
Construct circuits using pneumatic logic gates in safety and multi-stationed control systems
Discuss processing elements such as flow control, time delay and pressure sequence valves
Explain key steps to pneumatic design using a case study
Practice troubleshooting skills with each pneumatic circuit application

learningOutcomes.title: Interpret electro-pneumatic drawings
objectives: Identify electro-pneumatic circuit drawing symbols
Discuss electro-pneumatic drawing procedures
Explain the electro-pneumatic 3/2 way directional control valve elements
Discuss the difference between the electrical control and pneumatic control drawing symbols for the electric solenoid
Describe the electric limit switch in four configurations and apply the switch as a feedback device
Apply a 5/2 way electrically actuated directional control valves in small circuit designs
Construct trigger and feedback circuits using non-contact proximity sensors

learningOutcomes.title: Design an electro-pneumatic control system for a given application
objectives: Apply a non-contact, magnetically triggered reed switch
Apply a vacuum/pressure sensor in a small circuit application
Practice using air and power shutdown safety systems
Study a practical list of steps to solving circuit design applications using a case study
Create and build an electro-pneumatic solution to a given problem
Practice troubleshooting skills in each electro-pneumatic circuit application

learningOutcomes.title: Explain safe installations of PLC applications in the workplace
objectives: Interpret PLC circuit drawing symbols
Discuss PLC drawing procedures
Discuss the purpose of a PLC
Describe a list of questions to ask when deciding on a PLC purchase
Explain a PLC and it's structure
Identify the inputs and outputs of a PLC
Describe typical modes of program operations
Practice communications between personal and industrial computers

learningOutcomes.title: Program a PLC using fundamental codes
objectives: Open the application software to program a PLC
Practice program editing techniques
Describe and use commands such as one-shot, time-delay, and set/reset latches
Discuss basic Boolean statements such as AND, OR and NOT
Apply Boolean logic to programming relay ladder logic
Explain PLC configurations and expansion modules
Identify processor status and other memory area configurations
Describe PLC troubleshooting techniques to solve problems

learningOutcomes.title: Explain robot applications for the manufacturing workplace
objectives: Discuss a brief history of robotics in industry
Describe a work cell
Explain the basic layout of a robot in a work cell
Apply safe practices when working near or around robotic arms
Locate safe zones of robotic arm installations
Describe the robot controller and the display options
Locate the teach pendant and the safety enable switch for manual movement operations
Explain robot axes, work envelopes, payload and degrees of freedom
Discuss tool path collision models and discuss safe tool movement practices
Describe tooling and tool co-ordinates
